intro: Tristemon falcatus, commonly known as the sickleleaf tristemon, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its narrow, sickle-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. Tristemon falcatus is often found in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests or along stream banks.
